text: $Plane Captain before we hop back in to this project and reinitialize bmad (legacy migration) let's do a thorough inspection of our Plane board and cross references what's there with our latest old bmad stuff in @bmad-legacy
ok great, let's do that. Then I want to do a full audit from user perspective to align on how imi should be used by humand and agent

Ok, then I think we need to lock down the new workspace rules (where the worktrees will live). I don't want them to live inside a master cloned repo. It needs to mirror anthroporphic pattern. Each agent will be assign their own workspace where they will clone the repo and create their worktrees. Like their own "office"
